intro: Stegolepis wurdackii subsp. wurdackii, commonly known as the Wurdack's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and distinctive yellow-orange cyathia. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. It has a low, spreading growth habit with branched stems and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species in botanical gardens and horticultural collections.
